ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How much time does your child use or watch one or more of the following in the 1.5 hours before bedtime: Television
How much time does your child use or watch one or more of the following in the 1.5 hours before bedtime: Computer (internet/games)
How much time does your child use or watch one or more of the following in the 1.5 hours before bedtime: Tablet (e.g. iPad)
How much time does your child use or watch one or more of the following in the 1.5 hours before bedtime: Mobile Phone
How much time does your child use or watch one or more of the following in the 1.5 hours before bedtime: All Devices
Does your child use one of the following in the bedroom when he or she lies down to go to sleep: Television
Does your child use one of the following in the bedroom when he or she lies down to go to sleep: Computer
Does your child use one of the following in the bedroom when he or she lies down to go to sleep: Tablet Computer (e.g.iPad) or Mobile Phone
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data

Notes: 1= subject; 2= parent; 3= clinician; 4= teacher; 5= trainer; 6= fidelity reviewer
